page.title: 09ORAL HISTORY-GIRLS' WORK
page.content:
The following 3 pages evolved from an oral history project carried out by a third year class.James interviewed Gertie Henderson and Mrs. Finn.
Girls started work at 13 which was the school leaving age before the 2nd World War.Most jobs were poorly paid. Many girls would get about 7s 3d (36p today) weekly. The working community was a happy one.But many young girls would not keep their first jobs and tried to find a new job. At home girls would do jobs to earn extra money.Boys and girls would do different jobs at home.But they both had an even chance of getting a job.
